alert.note: Alert for Bosque (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 24 at 3:02AM CST by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM CST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of central and north central Texas, including the following counties, in central Texas, Bosque. In north central Texas, Hood, Johnson, Parker, Somervell and Tarrant. * WHEN...Until 500 AM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Fort Worth, Arlington, Euless, Bedford, Grapevine, Haltom City, Keller, Hurst, Burleson, Cleburne, Southlake, Weatherford, Watauga, Colleyville, Benbrook, Saginaw, White Settlement, Crowley, Forest Hill and Azle.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
